Key Match Events: England defeated Sri Lanka by 4 wickets with 2 balls left.
Ben Stokes played a crucial innings, scoring 42 runs off 36 balls and emerged as an efficient finisher.
Mark Wood took 3 wickets for 26 runs in 3 overs.
Pathum Nissanka scored 67 runs off 45 balls for Sri Lanka.
Wanindu Hasaranga took 2 wickets for 23 runs in 4 overs for Sri Lanka.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka made one change from the team which defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in the last game, bringing in fast bowler Chamika Karunaratne in place of Pramod Madushan.
The pitch at Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) has been beneficial for batting in the tournament so far and has been a headache for pace bowlers.
Post-Match Reflections: England entered the T20 World Cup semi-finals with this victory.
Defending champions Australia lost all hopes of winning this World Cup.
